extendedIngredients.name: arugula
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound arugula, stems discarded and leaves chopped
extendedIngredients.originalName: arugula, stems discarded and leaves chopped

extendedIngredients.name: pork tenderloin
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 pounds pork tenderloin, cut into 1-inch-thick medallions

extendedIngredients.name: prosciutto
extendedIngredients.original: 5 ounces thinly sliced prosciutto, finely chopped

title: Pork with Arugula, Prosciutto and Tomatoes
summary: Pork with Arugula, Prosciutto and Tomatoes is a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal main course. For $4.73 per serving, this recipe covers 41% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. One serving contains 472 calories, 44g of protein, and 28g of fat. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. If you have prosciutto, balsamic vinegar, garlic cloves, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 82%. This score is outstanding. Similar recipes include White Pizza With Prosciutto, Arugulan And Tomatoes, Arugula & Prosciutto Pizza, and Arugula & Prosciutto Flatbread.
instructions: In a very large skillet, heat the olive oil. Add the prosciutto and garlic and cook over moderate heat, stirring, until the garlic is golden, about 4 minutes. Transfer to a plate.                                              Season the pork medallions with salt and pepper, add them to the skillet and cook over moderately high heat until well browned on the outside and medium within, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer the medallions to a plate and keep warm.                                              Add the balsamic vinegar to the skillet and cook until nearly evaporated, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the skillet. Add the arugula and toss until wilted, about 2 minutes. Add the tomatoes and the prosciutto and garlic. Cook over high heat for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally; season with salt and pepper. Transfer the arugula to a platter, top with the pork and serve.

steps.step: In a very large skillet, heat the olive oil.
Add the prosciutto and garlic and cook over moderate heat, stirring, until the garlic is golden, about 4 minutes.
Season the pork medallions with salt and pepper, add them to the skillet and cook over moderately high heat until well browned on the outside and medium within, 3 to 4 minutes per side.
Transfer the medallions to a plate and keep warm.
Add the balsamic vinegar to the skillet and cook until nearly evaporated, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the skillet.
Add the arugula and toss until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and the prosciutto and garlic. Cook over high heat for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally; season with salt and pepper.
Transfer the arugula to a platter, top with the pork and serve.
